message_1: Simplify the logarithmic expression log(base 2)(64) - log(base 2)(8).
message_2:
To simplify the logarithmic expression log(base 2)(64) - log(base 2)(8), we can use the logarithmic property:

log(base b)(a) - log(base b)(c) = log(base b)(a/c)

Applying this property, we get:

log(base 2)(64/8)

Now, we simplify the fraction:

log(base 2)(8)

Since 2^3 = 8, the logarithmic expression simplifies to:

3
